title: 5 killed in west Sudan tribal violence, rights group says
description: Tribal leaders in Sudan say two days of tribal violence in African country’s west have killed at least 5 people

title: Putin, charged with war crimes, must limit travel to avoid arrest
description: The 123 countries that belong to the International Criminal Court are legally obligated to arrest the Russian leader but some nations have flouted the court's orders in the past.

title: Human rights groups criticize Cuba’s new criminal code
description: Cuba enacted a new penal code this week that activists and human rights organizations worry could further limit free expression and snuff out protests at a time of deepening discontent on the island

title: Biden warns Iran after U.S. forces clash with proxy groups in Syria
description: President Biden said that while the U.S. wants to avoid a wider confrontation with Iran, indiscriminate attacks on U.S. troops would not go unpunished.

title: Protesters in Suriname demand president resign
description: A few hundred protesters have gathered in Suriname’s capital to demand that the president of the South American country resign

title: Reports: Islamic State kidnaps dozens in Syria, dead found
description: Syrian reports say members of the Islamic State group have kidnapped dozens of people in a central province and the bodies of some have been found with their throats slits

title: 3 astronauts delayed on space station to return in September
description: Russia’s space agency says three astronauts who were supposed to leave the International Space Station this month will be brought back to Earth in late September

title: Mexican president pushes back on US criticism on violence
description: Mexico’s president angrily rejected comments by U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken that the Mexican government has lost control of parts of the country

title: Man threatens passengers on German train, injures teenager
description: Police say a man has threatened passengers on a train in eastern Germany and injured a teenager with an ax-like implement

title: Cuba holds national elections with no opposition candidates
description: Cuba holds National Assembly elections Sunday, but there are only 470 candidates running for the 470 seats, with no opposition challengers and no campaigning

title: With eye on British Museum, Greece welcomes back ancient art
description: Greece has welcomed the return of ancient artifacts from the Acropolis, furthering a campaign to press the British Museum to hand back a collection of sculptures taken from the ancient site in Athens more than 200 years ago

title: German extremist jailed for driving into police officer
description: A German anti-government extremist has been convicted of attempted murder and sentenced to 10 years in prison for deliberately driving into a police officer during an attempted traffic check while intoxicated

title: Art duo Glibert and George get their own gallery in London
description: U.K.-based art duo Gilbert and George have been creating beguiling and unsettling art together for over half a century

title: Watchdog: Israel promotes bids for 1,000 settlement homes
description: An Israeli watchdog group says that Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s far-right government has authorized construction bids for over a thousand new homes in Jewish settlements in the occupied West Bank and east Jerusalem

title: Brazil's Bolsonaro hands undeclared jewels to authorities
description: A representative of Brazil’s former President Jair Bolsonaro on Friday handed a set of diamond jewelry he had received from Saudi Arabia to a state bank, as he was ordered to do by a government watchdog

title: Rwanda to free Paul Rusesabagina, inspiration for ‘Hotel Rwanda,’ government says
description: Rwanda says it will release Paul Rusesabagina, a former hotel manager portrayed as a hero in a Hollywood film about the 1994 genocide, after he was sentenced to 25 years in prison on terrorism charges in 2021.

title: Rwanda says Rusesabagina of 'Hotel Rwanda' fame to be freed
description: Rwanda’s government has commuted the sentence of Paul Rusesabagina, who inspired the film “Hotel Rwanda” for saving hundreds of countrymen from genocide but was convicted of terrorism offenses years later in a widely criticized trial

title: India’s top opposition leader Gandhi expelled from parliament after verdict
description: The defamation conviction of Rahul Gandhi, which supporters say is politically motivated, also means he cannot run for any elections for the next six years.

title: Former rebel leader is named Congo's new Defense Minister
description: Congo’s former rebel leader jailed by the International Criminal Court, Jean-Pierre Bemba, has been appointed Congo’s Defense Minister and Deputy Prime Minister in a Cabinet reshuffle

title: You can walk on the mosaic where King Charles will be crowned — in your socks
description: Visitors to London’s Westminster Abbey will be able to stand on the rare Cosmati pavement where King Charles will be crowned — but they'll have to take their shoes off.

title: Man drives into pedestrians inside German airport garage
description: Police say a motorist has driven into several pedestrians in a parking garage at Cologne-Bonn Airport in western Germany

title: For China, embattled TikTok chief is hero defying bullying U.S.
description: Chinese companies planning to invest in the United States are also expressing worry that they might face similar treatment as Shou Zi Chew.

title: Israeli AG warns Netanyahu defied conflict of interest rule
description: Israel’s attorney general has warned Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu that he violated the Supreme Court’s conflict of interest ruling, which barred him from direct involvement in his government’s divisive plans for a judicial overhaul

title: France announces King Charles postponing visit amid pension protests
description: Macron had been preparing to host King Charles and Camilla for the first state visit of his reign.

title: Grindr warns Egyptian police may be using fake accounts to trap users
description: The gay dating app is sending regular warnings to its users in Egypt, alleging that the authorities are using fake accounts for entrapment.

title: Hong Kong fire forces 3,400 people to evacuate
description: Hong Kong firefighters were battling a blaze at a warehouse that forced 3,400 people to evacuate, including students

title: UK demonstrators protest Israeli leader's visit to London
description: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak has welcomed Israeli leader Benjamin Netanyahu to his Downing Street office while demonstrators gathered nearby to protest Netanyahu’s right-wing policies

title: Warm winter threatens beloved Canadian tradition: The hair-freezing contest
description: Climate change and warmer winters threaten to disrupt the annual hair-freezing contest at Eclipse Nordic Hot Springs in Canada’s Yukon region.

title: Hundreds evacuated as Spain's fire season starts early
description: Hundreds of people have been evacuated as a major forest fire rages in Spain’s eastern Castellón region, marking an early start to the nation’s fire season amid bone dry conditions

title: Scattered protests continue as Paris reels from violence
description: Protesters angry at French President Emmanuel Macron are continuing scattered actions on Friday following mass demonstrations the previous day

title: Serbia: 9 migrants found among aluminum rolls in truck
description: Serbia’s customs authorities say they have discovered nine migrants hiding among aluminum rolls in a truck headed to Poland from Greece

title: China, Haiti and migration top agenda for Biden-Trudeau meeting
description: Biden makes his first visit to Canada as president at a time of growing international tensions.

title: Drone attack kills U.S. contractor in Syria, unleashing airstrike response
description: The Pentagon launched precision airstrikes in response to the attack, which officials attributed to militants affiliated with Iran.

title: Hong Kong traffic accident leaves some 70 people injured
description: Four passenger buses and a truck have collided near a Hong Kong road tunnel and about 70 people were injured, including children

title: Elderly Ukrainian helicopters pummel Russians from afar
description: The Ukrainian army is using Soviet-era helicopters on missions to the front lines in the fight against Russia’s invasion of Ukraine

title: Zebra who ran through busy Seoul streets escaped zoo after parents died
description: Sero's rebellious streak emerged after the deaths of both his parents, zoo officials said. He was caught after his escapade and is safely home.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Zelensky visits the front line in Kherson; European allies promise more artillery
description: European Union leaders pledged to jointly deliver 1 million artillery rounds over the next year. They said they will also provide missiles, upon Kyiv’s request.

title: The secretive Israeli think tank behind Netanyahu’s judicial overhaul
description: The role of the Kohelet Policy Forum in Israel's controversial judicial overhaul has shown the far-reaching political influence of the once obscure think tank.

title: Between Avdiivka and Bakhmut, Ukrainian forces fight Russia on tough terrain
description: Some front-line Ukranian positions near the town of Niu-York have not moved since 2014, but Russians are pushing south from Bakhmut and north from Avdiivka, aiming to encircle them.

title: The U.S. connection to Uganda’s ‘kill the gays’ bill
description: While Republican lawmakers are engineering a wave of anti-LGBTQ legislation in some states, U.S. religious groups have campaigned in Africa for hard-line measures there.
